section.title: Package Managers
section.para: The only implementations of a package manager that has been released so far is for the eXist database and for the Saxon XSLT and XQuery processor. Both those implementations are just prototypes, provided as an external application to install and delete packages, and based on the being-defined Packaging System module. So this module, and those implementations can evolve (and will do) in the near future, depending on the feedback got from the community.

The package manager for eXist is provided as a single JAR file. Just download it and launch it the usual way (depending on your platform, that could be by double-clicking on it, or by executing the command java -jar expath-pkg-exist-0.1.jar.) For now, it requires a windowing system, but a text oriented interface will be provided later, to enable its usage on graphical-less environments, like servers. You can find a step-by-step presentation of this package manager in the following blog post.

The package manager for Saxon is provided as a single JAR file. If you launch it (either by double-clicking on it, or by executing the command java -jar expath-pkg-saxon-0.1.jar) the package manager itself starts. This is the graphical application which allows you to install and remove packages, and manage repositories. This JAR file also contains classes needed at runtime by Saxon to resolve the stuff installed in the repository. If you want to call Saxon from a shell window, you can use the following shell script to set up correctly your classpath. You can find a step-by-step presentation of this package manager in the following blog post.
